OIFM_GMTS_004244.name: abdominal abscess
OIFM_GMTS_004244.description: A localized collection of pus in the abdomen

OIFM_MSFT_134126.name: abdominal aortic aneurysm
OIFM_MSFT_134126.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a localized dilation of the abdominal aorta, typically defined as a diameter greater than 3 cm, which can lead to rupture and significant morbidity or mortality.

OIFM_GMTS_003106.name: abdominal lymphadenopathy
OIFM_GMTS_003106.description: Enlarged lymph nodes in the abdominal region

OIFM_OIDM_023679.name: abnormal intracranial enhancement
OIFM_OIDM_023679.description: Focal or diffuse increased enhancement within intracranial structures on contrast-enhanced CT or MRI indicating disruption of the blood–brain barrier or abnormal vascularity; common causes include neoplasm, infection/abscess, inflammation, subacute infarction, hemorrhage, and postoperative/iatrogenic change. The original phrasing 'abnormal intracranial enhancement' is an example of this finding.

OIFM_GMTS_017436.name: adrenal tumor
OIFM_GMTS_017436.description: Neoplastic growth within the adrenal gland, could be benign or malignant.

OIFM_GMTS_014057.name: aortic aneurysm
OIFM_GMTS_014057.description: An abnormal bulge in the wall of the aorta.

OIFM_GMTS_000480.name: ascites
OIFM_GMTS_000480.description: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.

OIFM_GMTS_022519.name: atherosclerosis
OIFM_GMTS_022519.description: Thickening or hardening of the arteries due to plaque buildup.

OIFM_OIDM_267712.name: basal cistern effacement
OIFM_OIDM_267712.description: Loss, narrowing, or obliteration of the cerebrospinal fluid–filled basal (perimesencephalic) cisterns on CT or MRI due to mass effect from edema, hemorrhage, or a space-occupying lesion. This finding commonly reflects elevated intracranial pressure and may indicate increased risk of transtentorial herniation; the original phrasing 'basal cistern effacement' is an example of this imaging appearance.

OIFM_OIDM_437042.name: urinary bladder abnormality
OIFM_OIDM_437042.description: Urinary bladder abnormality is a non-specific radiologic descriptor for any irregularity of the bladder identified on imaging, including contour irregularities, wall thickening, intraluminal masses, or calcifications. Correlation with clinical history and, if indicated, additional targeted imaging or endoscopic evaluation may be required to define etiology.

OIFM_GMTS_017328.name: bladder calculus
OIFM_GMTS_017328.description: Stone formation within the urinary bladder.

ontology_codes.display: Small calculus particles in urinary bladder
Calcium oxalate calculus of urinary bladder
Calculus in diverticulum of urinary bladder

OIFM_OIDM_201175.name: bowel inflammation
OIFM_OIDM_201175.description: Radiologic finding representing inflammation of the bowel; commonly demonstrated by bowel wall thickening with mural hyperenhancement and surrounding mesenteric stranding. This finding can be described as 'bowel inflammatory signs' and is seen in enteritis or colitis and may be accompanied by luminal dilation.
synonyms: bowel wall thickening with mural enhancement

OIFM_GMTS_031526.name: calcification in a tendon
OIFM_GMTS_031526.description: Calcium deposition within a tendon, often due to chronic tendinopathy.

OIFM_GMTS_022537.name: cardiomegaly
OIFM_GMTS_022537.description: Enlargement of the heart size beyond normal limits.

OIFM_MSFT_440456.name: Cerebral Aneurysm
OIFM_MSFT_440456.description: An abnormal bulging in a blood vessel in the brain that can lead to serious complications such as rupture or hemorrhage.

OIFM_OIDM_786384.name: cerebral atrophy
OIFM_OIDM_786384.description: Cerebral atrophy denotes loss of cerebral parenchymal volume, often diffuse but can be regional. The original phrase provided, "cerebral volume loss", is a commonly used radiology descriptor for this finding.

OIFM_GMTS_007619.name: cerebral infarction
OIFM_GMTS_007619.description: Death of brain tissue due to inadequate blood supply.

OIFM_OIDM_093125.name: cerebral small vessel disease
OIFM_OIDM_093125.description: Cerebral small vessel disease is characterized by chronic ischemic changes of the brain due to small vessel pathology, typically presenting as diffuse or focal white matter hyperintensities with possible lacunes or microbleeds. The original phrasing 'small vessel ischemic disease' may be used to describe this finding in radiology reports.

ontology_codes.display: HTRA1-related autosomal dominant cerebral small vessel disease

OIFM_OIDM_456265.name: chiari malformation
OIFM_OIDM_456265.description: chiari malformation is downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum, potentially causing brainstem crowding and syringomyelia in some patients (original phrasing: 'chiari malformation'). MRI is the preferred modality to confirm the diagnosis and assess associated craniovertebral anomalies.

OIFM_GMTS_000570.name: cholecystitis
OIFM_GMTS_000570.description: Inflammation of the gallbladder, usually due to gallstones blocking the bile ducts.

ontology_codes.display: Calculus of gallbladder with acute cholecystitis

OIFM_OIDM_842151.name: clavicle fracture
OIFM_OIDM_842151.description: Fracture of the clavicle with disruption of the bony cortex. It may be displaced or nondisplaced and can involve the midshaft or the medial or lateral end.

ontology_codes.display: Open multiple fractures of clavicle and/or scapula and/or humerus
Closed multiple fractures of clavicle and/or scapula and/or humerus

OIFM_OIDM_500879.name: colonic diverticulitis
OIFM_OIDM_500879.description: Colonic diverticulitis is inflammation or infection of colonic diverticula, most commonly involving the sigmoid colon; the original input 'colornic diverticulitis' illustrates the need to standardize terminology. On cross-sectional imaging, findings include focal colonic wall thickening with pericolonic fat stranding, and complicated disease may present with abscess, phlegmon, or perforation.

OIFM_OIDM_388787.name: colonic diverticulosis
OIFM_OIDM_388787.description: Presence of multiple diverticula within the colon, most commonly in the sigmoid colon, seen as outpouchings along the colonic wall. It is typically an incidental finding and does not show signs of acute inflammation unless diverticulitis is present.

OIFM_MSFT_430810.name: coronary artery calcifications
OIFM_MSFT_430810.description: Atherosclerotic calcifications of the coronary arteries

OIFM_GMTS_005486.name: cystic liver lesion
OIFM_GMTS_005486.description: Fluid-filled lesion within the liver tissue.

OIFM_GMTS_025663.name: degenerative joint changes
OIFM_GMTS_025663.description: Alterations in joint structure due to chronic wear or arthritis; common with aging.

ontology_codes.display: Degenerative joint disease of ankle AND/OR foot

OIFM_GMTS_004740.name: diffuse gallbladder wall thickening
OIFM_GMTS_004740.description: Thickening of the gallbladder wall seen diffusely

OIFM_OIDM_990401.name: diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis
OIFM_OIDM_990401.description: Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis (DISH) is characterized radiographically by flowing calcifications along the anterior longitudinal ligament spanning at least four contiguous vertebral bodies with preservation of intervertebral disc height. It may be associated with peripheral enthesopathy and does not typically involve sacroiliac joint fusion.

ontology_codes.display: Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of cervicothoracic spine
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of cervical spine
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of thoracic spine
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of lumbar spine
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of thoracolumbar spine
Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis of lumbosacral spine

OIFM_GMTS_005226.name: dilated bile ducts
OIFM_GMTS_005226.description: Enlargement of the bile ducts suggestive of obstruction

ontology_codes.display: Cystic dilatation of common bile duct
Congenital dilatation of common bile duct
Congenital dilatation of lobar intrahepatic bile duct
Acquired cystic dilatation of common bile duct
Congenital cystic dilatation of common bile duct
congenital dilatation of lobar intrahepatic bile duct

OIFM_GMTS_004609.name: dilated intrahepatic ducts
OIFM_GMTS_004609.description: Expansion of the bile ducts within the liver

ontology_codes.display: Congenital dilatation of lobar intrahepatic bile duct
congenital dilatation of lobar intrahepatic bile duct
Congenital dilatation of lobar intrahepatic bile duct with obstruction

OIFM_GMTS_002674.name: dilated pancreatic duct
OIFM_GMTS_002674.description: Expansion of the pancreatic duct, often due to obstruction

OIFM_GMTS_017947.name: dural sinus thrombosis
OIFM_GMTS_017947.description: The formation of a blood clot in one of the brain's dural venous sinuses.

ontology_codes.display: Nonpyogenic thrombosis of intracranial venous sinus
Cerebral venous thrombosis of straight sinus
Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis in pregnancy
Neonatal thrombosis of cerebral venous sinus
Neonatal noninfectious cerebral venous sinus thrombosis

OIFM_GMTS_017620.name: enlarged prostate
OIFM_GMTS_017620.description: Increase in prostate size, often indicating benign prostatic hyperplasia

ontology_codes.display: Benign prostatic hyperplasia with outflow obstruction
Benign prostatic hyperplasia without outflow obstruction

OIFM_GMTS_014833.name: extensive pulmonary opacity with cavitation
OIFM_GMTS_014833.description: Large area of lung opacity with cavitation, seen in infections, malignancy, or infarction.

OIFM_GMTS_022461.name: fatty liver
OIFM_GMTS_022461.description: Accumulation of excess fat in liver cells

OIFM_GMTS_022482.name: gallstone
OIFM_GMTS_022482.description: Stone formation in the gallbladder or bile duct.

ontology_codes.display: Calculus of gallbladder without cholecystitis or cholangitis

OIFM_GMTS_017277.name: generalized bladder wall thickening
OIFM_GMTS_017277.description: Thickening of the bladder wall which may indicate inflammation or other causes.

OIFM_GMTS_010762.name: generalized osteoporosis
OIFM_GMTS_010762.description: Reduction in bone density throughout the skeleton, leading to fragile bones.

OIFM_GMTS_014547.name: ground-glass pulmonary opacity
OIFM_GMTS_014547.description: Hazy increased lung opacity with preserved bronchial and vascular markings.

OIFM_OIDM_160831.name: hepatic lesion
OIFM_OIDM_160831.description: A hepatic lesion denotes a focal abnormality of the liver parenchyma detected on imaging. The finding encompasses a spectrum of etiologies from benign to malignant, and further characterization with dedicated liver imaging is often required to refine the diagnosis.

ontology_codes.display: Fracture of upper end of humerus

OIFM_GMTS_007816.name: hydrocephalus
OIFM_GMTS_007816.description: Accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain ventricles leading to increased pressure.

OIFM_OIDM_874812.name: hydronephrosis
OIFM_OIDM_874812.description: Hydronephrosis refers to dilation of the renal pelvis and calyces caused by obstruction to urinary outflow distal to the kidney. It may be unilateral or bilateral; chronic obstruction can lead to cortical thinning and impaired renal function.

OIFM_OIDM_668318.name: inferior vena cava thrombosis
OIFM_OIDM_668318.description: Inferior vena cava thrombosis is the formation of a thrombus within the lumen of the inferior vena cava. On cross-sectional imaging, it appears as an intraluminal filling defect and may be associated with venous dilation; this finding is exemplified by the original phrasing 'IVC thrombosis'.
synonyms: thrombosis of the inferior vena cava

ontology_codes.display: Chronic thrombosis of inferior vena cava
Acute thrombosis of inferior vena cava
Tumor thrombus of inferior vena cava

OIFM_CDE_000019.name: Inflammatory Sinus
OIFM_CDE_000019.description: This module describes the Common Data elements and Macros for Inflammatory Sinus

OIFM_GMTS_022484.name: intestinal obstruction
OIFM_GMTS_022484.description: Blockage that prevents the normal flow of intestinal contents.

OIFM_MSFT_218756.name: Intracerebral Hemorrhage
OIFM_MSFT_218756.description: Intracerebral hemorrhage refers to bleeding that occurs within the brain tissue itself, often due to a ruptured blood vessel.

OIFM_OIDM_119725.name: intracranial mass
OIFM_OIDM_119725.description: A focal space-occupying lesion within the cranial cavity that may reflect neoplasm, hemorrhage, infection, or other pathology; may cause edema or mass effect depending on size and location. The original phrasing 'intracranial mass' is provided as an example use case.

OIFM_OIDM_972279.name: intracranial vascular abnormality
OIFM_OIDM_972279.description: A generic descriptor for any abnormality of the intracranial vasculature, which may include aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation, arteriovenous fistula, stenosis, or other vascular abnormality. The provided phrase 'intracranial vascular abnormality' serves as an example use case of this category.

OIFM_GMTS_012821.name: joint effusion
OIFM_GMTS_012821.description: Excess fluid accumulation in or around a joint.

OIFM_GMTS_032553.name: lobar atelectasis
OIFM_GMTS_032553.description: Collapse or loss of volume in an entire lobe of the lung.

OIFM_OIDM_786838.name: loss of gray-white differentiation
OIFM_OIDM_786838.description: Loss of gray-white differentiation is a radiologic sign in which the distinction between the cortical gray matter and the underlying white matter is diminished, most commonly reflecting cerebral edema or acute ischemia. It is detectable on CT or MRI and can indicate early brain injury.

OIFM_OIDM_481402.name: lumbar spine degenerative change
OIFM_OIDM_481402.description: Degenerative changes of the lumbar spine refer to age-related or wear-related alterations such as disc-space narrowing, facet arthropathy, endplate sclerosis, and osteophyte formation. The original term 'lumbar spine degenerative changes' is encompassed by this canonical form.
synonyms: degenerative change of the lumbar spine
degenerative changes of the lumbar spine

OIFM_GMTS_015972.name: massive pleural effusion
OIFM_GMTS_015972.description: A very large collection of fluid in the pleural space.

OIFM_OIDM_228653.name: mastoid air cell effusion
OIFM_OIDM_228653.description: Fluid within the mastoid air cell system visible on imaging, presenting as opacification of the mastoid region. This finding may reflect otitis media with effusion or mastoiditis; the original term "mastoid air cell fluid" illustrates this context.

OIFM_GMTS_015734.name: mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node enlargement
OIFM_GMTS_015734.description: Enlargement of lymph nodes in the mediastinum and/or hilar lung regions.

OIFM_OIDM_159498.name: mitral annular calcification
OIFM_OIDM_159498.description: Mitral annular calcification is degenerative calcification of the fibrous ring (annulus) of the mitral valve, commonly seen in older patients. It may be incidental on imaging and can be associated with reduced annular compliance and mild mitral valve dysfunction.

OIFM_OIDM_208758.name: orbital mass
OIFM_OIDM_208758.description: An orbital mass is a space-occupying lesion within the orbit that may arise from lacrimal gland, extraocular muscles, or other orbital tissues and can be benign or malignant; imaging features aid in characterization and differential diagnosis, with 'orbital mass' serving as the exemplar original phrasing.

OIFM_OIDM_371547.name: pancreatic lesion
OIFM_OIDM_371547.description: A focal abnormality within the pancreatic parenchyma identified on imaging. The term 'pancreatic lesion' is a non-specific descriptor that may represent cystic, solid, or inflammatory processes and often requires further imaging characterization and, when appropriate, tissue sampling for definitive diagnosis.

OIFM_OIDM_467681.name: parapelvic renal cyst
OIFM_OIDM_467681.description: Parapelvic renal cyst is a fluid-filled, non-enhancing cyst of the renal sinus adjacent to the renal pelvis. On imaging, it appears as a well-defined, simple cyst that does not communicate with the collecting system and may be incidentally encountered; large lesions may cause calyceal compression or hydronephrosis.

OIFM_GMTS_014559.name: peribronchovascular interstitial thickening
OIFM_GMTS_014559.description: Thickening of the connective tissues around the bronchi and vessels, often associated with interstitial lung diseases.

OIFM_GMTS_003706.name: pericardial effusion
OIFM_GMTS_003706.description: Accumulation of fluid in the pericardial cavity

OIFM_OIDM_920919.name: peripancreatic fluid
OIFM_OIDM_920919.description: Fluid accumulation in the peripancreatic space on cross-sectional imaging, representing inflammatory exudate or fluid collection surrounding the pancreas. It is commonly associated with acute pancreatitis, pancreatic injury, postoperative leakage, or evolution into a pancreatic pseudocyst.

OIFM_GMTS_007598.name: periventricular t2 hyperintense lesion
OIFM_GMTS_007598.description: An area adjacent to the ventricles that appears bright on T2-weighted MR images, suggestive of demyelination or gliosis.

OIFM_MSFT_213340.name: pleural abnormality
OIFM_MSFT_213340.description: A pleural abnormality refers to any pathological change affecting the pleura, the tissue layers enveloping the lungs. These abnormalities may include pleural effusion, thickening, plaques, or pneumothorax, and can be indicative of various underlying conditions such as infection, malignancy, or autoimmune disease.

OIFM_GMTS_015999.name: pleural thickening
OIFM_GMTS_015999.description: Increase in thickness of the pleural lining

OIFM_CDE_000076.name: Pneumonia
OIFM_CDE_000076.description: This module describes the Common Data elements and Macros for Pneumonia

OIFM_GMTS_023339.name: pneumothorax
OIFM_GMTS_023339.description: Presence of gas or air in the pleural space.

OIFM_GMTS_035534.name: portal vein thrombosis
OIFM_GMTS_035534.description: Blood clot formation within the portal vein

OIFM_OIDM_332518.name: prostatic abnormality
OIFM_OIDM_332518.description: Prostatic abnormality refers to any deviation from normal prostate gland parenchyma on imaging. It is a non-specific descriptor that may reflect benign etiologies such as benign prostatic hyperplasia or inflammatory processes, or malignant disease. Further characterization with dedicated imaging and clinical correlation is typically required to define etiology.

OIFM_GMTS_013911.name: pulmonary artery aneurysm
OIFM_GMTS_013911.description: Ballooning or dilation of a pulmonary artery segment.

OIFM_OIDM_478641.name: pulmonary opacity
OIFM_OIDM_478641.description: Pulmonary opacity denotes an area of increased radiodensity within the lung parenchyma on chest radiographs or CT, which may be focal or diffuse. It is a non-specific finding with a broad differential including atelectasis, edema, infectious consolidation, hemorrhage, or neoplasm; the term 'pulmonary opacity' exemplifies this non-specific opacification.

OIFM_OIDM_745898.name: pulmonary scar
OIFM_OIDM_745898.description: Pulmonary scar denotes residual scarring of the lung parenchyma, typically reflecting prior inflammation or injury. Radiographically it may appear as linear or band-like markings, often subpleural or along fissures; correlate with history of prior infection, inflammation, trauma, or surgery.

OIFM_GMTS_033498.name: pulmonary segmental consolidation
OIFM_GMTS_033498.description: Consolidation confined to a segment of the lung.

OIFM_GMTS_020556.name: radiodense urinary calculus
OIFM_GMTS_020556.description: A radiopaque kidney stone detectable on radiography.

OIFM_GMTS_016635.name: renal cystic disease
OIFM_GMTS_016635.description: Presence of cysts in the kidneys, possibly indicating polycystic kidney disease.

ontology_codes.display: Medullary cystic disease of the kidney
Acquired cystic disease of transplanted kidney

OIFM_MGB_944849.name: Rib Fracture
OIFM_MGB_944849.description: Fracture of one or more ribs

OIFM_GMTS_030847.name: sellar lesion
OIFM_GMTS_030847.description: An abnormality in the sella turcica, often affecting the pituitary gland.

ontology_codes.display: Sellar ependymoma of posterior pituitary gland

OIFM_OIDM_452510.name: seminal vesicle abnormality
OIFM_OIDM_452510.description: Seminal vesicle abnormality denotes any structural abnormality of the seminal vesicles, including congenital anomalies, cystic dilation, mass lesions, or calcifications. Radiologic evaluation should document size, morphology, symmetry, and any communication with the ejaculatory ducts, with attention to unilateral versus bilateral involvement and to associated findings such as ejaculatory duct obstruction.

OIFM_OIDM_309677.name: cranial abnormality
OIFM_OIDM_309677.description: Cranial abnormality denotes any deviation from normal skull morphology evident on radiologic imaging. This umbrella term encompasses a range of etiologies (congenital, traumatic, infectious, developmental, or post-surgical changes); the original phrasing 'skull abnormality' may be used as an example of this finding.

ontology_codes.display: Congenital abnormality of skull and face bones

OIFM_GMTS_018633.name: skull base lesion
OIFM_GMTS_018633.description: Abnormal tissue or mass located at the base of the skull.

OIFM_OIDM_299401.name: soft tissue mass
OIFM_OIDM_299401.description: A focal soft-tissue abnormality that appears as a discrete or ill-defined mass within soft tissues on imaging. It encompasses a spectrum of etiologies from benign to malignant; correlation with clinical history and further imaging or biopsy may be required for characterization.

OIFM_GMTS_002512.name: solitary lesion of spleen
OIFM_GMTS_002512.description: A single mass located in the spleen.

OIFM_GMTS_014616.name: solitary pulmonary nodule
OIFM_GMTS_014616.description: A single rounded opacity in the lung less than or equal to 3 cm.

OIFM_GMTS_002817.name: spontaneous pneumoperitoneum without peritonitis
OIFM_GMTS_002817.description: Presence of air in the peritoneal cavity without infection signs.

OIFM_OIDM_675673.name: degenerative change of the thoracic spine
OIFM_OIDM_675673.description: Degenerative change of the thoracic spine, reflecting age-related spondylosis with multilevel degenerative alterations of the thoracic intervertebral discs and facet joints; this description corresponds to the original term 'thoracic spine degenerative changes' as an example context.
synonyms: degenerative changes of the thoracic spine

OIFM_OIDM_971596.name: fracture of the upper extremity
OIFM_OIDM_971596.description: Fracture of the upper extremity is a disruption of cortical continuity in any bone of the upper limb, from the shoulder girdle to the distal hand. Radiographic findings may include a fracture line with displacement, angulation, or rotation, and may be associated with dislocation or soft tissue injury depending on the location; this canonical name generalizes the original phrasing 'upper extremity fracture' as the example use case.

OIFM_GMTS_009850.name: wedged vertebra
OIFM_GMTS_009850.description: Triangular deformity of a vertebra usually due to compression or abnormal growth.

OIFM_GMTS_015685.name: wide mediastinum
OIFM_GMTS_015685.description: Increased width of the mediastinum, which may indicate mass, hemorrhage, or vascular anomaly.

OIFM_OIDM_029466.name: enostosis
OIFM_OIDM_029466.description: Enostosis is a benign, incidental focal intramedullary sclerotic lesion arising from the endosteal surface of cancellous bone. Radiographs typically show a well-defined, homogeneously dense focus within cancellous bone without aggressive features; 'bone island' is a common radiologic synonym and represents the original descriptive phrase.

ontology_codes.display: Lesion of bone of left radius and/or ulna
Lesion of bone of right radius and/or ulna

OIFM_MGB_311515.name: Glenohumeral Joint
OIFM_MGB_311515.description: The glenohumeral joint is the joint connecting the glenoid cavity of the scapula (shoulder blade) and the head of the humerus (upper arm bone).
